pull.title: Implement BIP 370 PSBTv2
pull.body: BIP 370 PSBTv2 introduces several new fields and different invariants for PSBT. This PR implements those new fields and restructures the PSBT implementation to match PSBTv2 but still remain compatible with PSBTv0.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
A summary of reviews will appear here.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#bitcoin-core/gui/733](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/733) (Deniability - a tool to automatically improve coin ownership privacy by denavila)
* [#27792](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27792) (wallet: Deniability API (Unilateral Transaction Meta-Privacy) by denavila)
* [#27101](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27101) (Support JSON-RPC 2.0 when requested by client by pinheadmz)
* [#25273](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25273) (wallet: Pass through transaction locktime and preset input sequences and scripts to CreateTransaction by achow101)
* [#24963](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24963) (RPC/Wallet: Convert walletprocesspsbt to use options parameter by luke-jr)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

In c8b879609f02288975e3a6f714fbcfa1a93edcbc (*moveonly: Move (Un)Serialize(To/From)Vector, (De)SerializeHDKeypaths to psbt module*), should you possibly move/copy `#include <streams.h>`, `#include <span.h>` and `#include <script/keyorigin.h>`?

In commit 0bd656b64e72e29f255a860c71c542f5a9f18c17 (*Separate individual HD Keypath serialization into separate functions*)

Should line:

```cpp
if (value_len % 4 || value_len == 0) {
```

be

```cpp
if (value_len % 4 != 0 || value_len == 0) {
```

to make it more explicit?

@kiminuo



> In commit [0bd656b](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/0bd656b64e72e29f255a860c71c542f5a9f18c17) (_Separate individual HD Keypath serialization into separate functions_)
> 
> Should line:
> 
> ```c++
> if (value_len % 4 || value_len == 0) {
> ```
> 
> be
> 
> ```c++
> if (value_len % 4 != 0 || value_len == 0) {
> ```
> 
> to make it more explicit?

This is moved code, so I will not be changing it.



> Is it possible that in commit [459fd3b](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/459fd3b0cc646f5ab02dd3cfd239c7a0418e6a32) (*Implement operator< for KeyOriginInfo and CExtPubKey *)
> 
> ```c++
> else if (a.pubkey > b.pubkey) {
>     return false;
> }
> ```
> 
> is missing?

Done.

***

In the future, please leave such comments on the code as inline comments rather than comments like this. It makes it much easier to respond directly to specific questions such as these.

Looking good so far. 

Ran this against CLN test suite and got no unexpected behavior.

events.message: Define psbtv2 field numbers

Change PSBT unknown fields test to use higher numbers

Previously these tests were using 0x0f as the field number. Changed to
use 0xf0 instead as it is unlikely we will hit that anytime soon.
Implement PSBTv2 fields de/ser
Have PSBTInput and PSBTOutput know the PSBT's version

Enforce PSBT version constraints

With PSBTv2, some fields are not allowed in PSBTv2, and some are
required. Enforce those.

Add PSBT::CacheUnsignedTxPieces

Fetches the PSBTv2 fields from PSBTv0's global unsigned tx. This allows
us to pretend everything internally is a PSBTv2 and makes things easier
to work with.
Call CacheUnsignedTxPieces in PSBT constructor

Convert PSBTv0 unsigned tx to PSBTv2 fields

This is just a convenience and doesn't effect serialization.

Replace PSBT::GetInputUTXO with PSBTInput::GetUTXO

Now that PSBTInput's track their own prevouts, there's no need for a
PSBT global function to fetch input specific data.

Add PSBT::ComputeLockTime()

Function to compute the lock time for the transaction

Add PSBT::GetUnsignedTx

A helper function for getting the unsigned transaction regardless of
psbt version.

Add PSBT::GetUniqueID

The unique ID for PSBTv2 is different from v0. Use this function to get
the ID without requiring the caller to know the version number.
Change PSBT::AddInput to take just PSBTInput
Change PSBT::AddOutput to take just PSBTOutput
Implement PSBTv2 field merging

Add PSBTInput::GetOutPoint

Helper for getting the PSBTInput COutPoint
Update SignPSBTInput for PSBTv2
Change PrecomputePSBTData to use GetUnsignedTx
Update FinalizeAndExtract for v2
Update AnalyzePSBT for PSBTv2
Update PSBT Operations Dialog for v2
Update RPCs for PSBTv2
Update wallet for PSBTv2
Implement PSBTv2 AddInput and AddOutput
Update PSBTInputSignedAndVerified for PSBTv2
Update test_framework/psbt.py for PSBTv2
Implement PSBTv2 in decodepsbt
Allow specifying PSBT version in constructor
Update PSBT::UpdatePSBTOutput to use GetUnsignedTx
Restrict joinpsbts to PSBTv0 only

Allow createpsbt and walletcreatefundedpsbt to take psbt version

Use v2 for other RPCs. For some tests to work, PSBTv0 is set explicitly.

Use GetUnsignedTx when serializing in PSBTv0

If we are asked to make a PSBTv0, we may not necessarily have made an
unsigned transaction. So instead use GetUnsignedTx which will either
fetch one that already exists, or construct a new one from the stored
data. Internally we may be storing a PSBTv0 like a PSBTv2, but still
want to serialize those as v0.
psbt: Change default psbt version to 2
tests: Add test vectors from BIP 370
tests: Add PSBT unit test for ComputeTimeLock

comments.body: I can't replicate this error at all, but I think I have fixed it.
This is erroring for me: `psbt.cpp:(.text+0x4ca): undefined reference to 'CTransaction::CURRENT_VERSION'`
@achow101, the BIP says that this should CompactSize which I assume means VarInt in bitcoin context? But the implementation serializes this as uint32_t
Oops, fixed.

I think it should be:

`if (m_version != std::nullopt && m_version > 0) {`
->
`if (m_version != std::nullopt && *m_version > 0) {`

at least your next commit makes me think so (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21283/commits/92ff609c1ef9d3cd848d08b4bbec1cdbf4ae4f0b#diff-2fb519d85c6ae99cd87c94e5b7cba43ff2ddd031b2c523dd2ffb12e991c16494R438)
Done
Should `#include <uint256.h>` be added?

Should the [original comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21283/commits/7d6ac06858d5f15de5fd86b2c055efd6c3bc8345#diff-2fb519d85c6ae99cd87c94e5b7cba43ff2ddd031b2c523dd2ffb12e991c16494L748) be preserved in some way?
Done. Keep in mind this commit (and the first 15 of this PR) are part of #17034 so comments on them are better suited for that PR.
Done
Done
does this constructor ever get used? I don't see it being used
should this be using `psbt_version`?
If we're internally defaulting to v2, probably better just to have constructor default for that value as well?
this function is only for v0, why would we remove something for v2?
Please add a test for this case
The intent is to enable this rpc for v2 in the future.
One was added in 318d818df7de30ac00551b655640512598ac1595
Dropped that commit.
Yes, done
Added a commit changing it. It's 0 when introduced in order to not break everything.
ah, wasn't clear to me
Is there a reason for this restriction?

IIRC updating this RPC would require pretty significant changes to it that felt out of scope for this PR. I've left it as something to do in a followup in order to keep the scope of the PR limited to just the bare minimum to work with PSBTv2.
